did.head: Records Summary
did.abstract: The BU Records: Carroll Buildings consist of correspondence regarding the furnishing of the F. L. Carroll Chapel and Library and the George W. Carroll Science Hall, as well as dedication programs from when the two buildings were dedicated.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: At the beginning of the twentieth century, construction of two new buildings became possible thanks to the generous donations of George W. Carroll and his father, F. L. Carroll. Construction of the first building began in 1901 May when George W. Carroll donated $60,000 to Baylor University to build a science hall. George’s contribution jumped to $75,000 when he later offered an additional $15,000 to equip the building. Only four months after George offered his first donation for the science hall, his father, F. L. Carroll, gave $50,000 to Baylor for a chapel and library.

The university held a joint two-day cornerstone laying ceremony for the two buildings in 1902 March. A little over a year later in 1903 April, both buildings were dedicated in a joint three-day celebration. When completed, the George W. Carroll Science Hall and the F. L. Carroll Chapel and Library greatly expanded the size of campus. While these buildings have been used for different purposes over the years, they are still in active use today and stand as tributes to the generosity of George W. Carroll, F. L. Carroll, and their families.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The BU Records: Carroll Buildings begins in 1900 July and ends in 1903 May. The correspondence series is the largest in the collection and consists of letters to and from E. R. Nash, treasurer of the Baylor University Board of Trustees, and chairman of the building committees that oversaw the construction of the two Carroll buildings. The letters contain information regarding the furnishing of the F. L. Carroll Chapel and Library and the George W. Carroll Science Hall. The collection also contains dedication programs from when the buildings were dedicated.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: No finding aid existed for the BU Records: Carroll Buildings prior to the creation of this one. Original order has been preserved.
The collection contains two series: I. Correspondence, II. Building Dedication.
